snippet: A mock island invasion exercise is the latest sign that worries over China and North Korea are pushing Japan away from pacifism.
abstract: Japan's decision to carry out mock island invasion is one of latest signs that nation, anxious about China's insistent claims over disputed islands and North Korea's escalating nuclear threats, is shifting further away from its postwar pacifism; escalation of assertiveness has been particularly apparent under leadership of Prime Min Shinzo Abe, conservative who has increased military spending for first time in 11 years.
lead_paragraph: A mock island invasion exercise is the latest sign that worries over China and North Korea are pushing Japan away from pacifism.

headline.seo: Japan Shifting Further Away From Pacifism
headline.main: Japan Shifts From Pacifism as Anxiety in Region Rises
headline.print_headline: Japan Shifting Further Away From Pacifism
